trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Engagement User Interface - My Account
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Engagement User Interface - My Account

trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage your account profile and test devices using Azure Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage your account profile and test devices using Azure Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: How to manage your account profile and test devices
trans-unit.target: How to manage your account profile and test devices

trans-unit.source: The My Account section of the UI is where you can view and change the settings associated with your account, including your Profile settings and test Device IDs.
trans-unit.target: The My Account section of the UI is where you can view and change the settings associated with your account, including your Profile settings and test Device IDs.

trans-unit.source: These settings contain items that can also be accessed via the Device API.
trans-unit.target: These settings contain items that can also be accessed via the Device API.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Troubleshooting Guide - Service[link 24]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Troubleshooting Guide - Service[link 24]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>MyAccount1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>MyAccount1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Profile:
trans-unit.target: Profile:

trans-unit.source: You can view or change any of your account settings: Password, First Name, Last Name, Organization, Phone Number, Time Zone, or E-mail opt-in or opt-out of e-mail updates.
trans-unit.target: You can view or change any of your account settings: Password, First Name, Last Name, Organization, Phone Number, Time Zone, or E-mail opt-in or opt-out of e-mail updates.

trans-unit.source: You can also give another user permission to use your application based on their e-mail address from “home”.
trans-unit.target: You can also give another user permission to use your application based on their e-mail address from “home”.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>UI Documentation - Home[link 13]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>UI Documentation - Home[link 13]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>MyAccount2</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>MyAccount2</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Devices:
trans-unit.target: Devices:

trans-unit.source: You can view, add, or remove test Device ID's of the test devices that you can use to test your reach or push campaigns.
trans-unit.target: You can view, add, or remove test Device ID's of the test devices that you can use to test your reach or push campaigns.

trans-unit.source: Contextual instructions for how to find the Device ID of devices for each platform (iOS, Android, Windows Phone, etc.)
trans-unit.target: Contextual instructions for how to find the Device ID of devices for each platform (iOS, Android, Windows Phone, etc.)

trans-unit.source: are displayed when you click "New Device".
trans-unit.target: are displayed when you click "New Device".

trans-unit.source: <linkText>MyAccount3</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>MyAccount3</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To use Push API or Device API you need to know your users' unique device identifier (the deviceid parameter).
trans-unit.target: To use Push API or Device API you need to know your users' unique device identifier (the deviceid parameter).

trans-unit.source: There are several ways to retrieve it:
trans-unit.target: There are several ways to retrieve it:

trans-unit.source: From your backend, you can use the "Get" feature of the Device API to get the full list of device identifiers.
trans-unit.target: From your backend, you can use the "Get" feature of the Device API to get the full list of device identifiers.

trans-unit.source: From your app, you can use the SDK to get it.
trans-unit.target: From your app, you can use the SDK to get it.

trans-unit.source: (On Android, call the getDeviceID() function of the Agent class, and on iOS, read the deviceid property of the Agent class.)
trans-unit.target: (On Android, call the getDeviceID() function of the Agent class, and on iOS, read the deviceid property of the Agent class.)

trans-unit.source: From a Reach announcement, if the action URL associated with the announcement contains the {deviceid} pattern, it will be automatically replaced by the identifier of the device triggering the action.
trans-unit.target: From a Reach announcement, if the action URL associated with the announcement contains the {deviceid} pattern, it will be automatically replaced by the identifier of the device triggering the action.

trans-unit.source: http://<html></html>.com/registeruser?deviceid={deviceid}&otherparam=myparamdata
trans-unit.target: http://<html></html>.com/registeruser?deviceid={deviceid}&otherparam=myparamdata

trans-unit.source: will be replaced by:
trans-unit.target: will be replaced by:

trans-unit.source: http://<html></html>.com/registeruser?deviceid=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX&otherparam=myparamdata
trans-unit.target: http://<html></html>.com/registeruser?deviceid=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX&otherparam=myparamdata

trans-unit.source: From a Reach web announcement, if the HTML code of the announcement contains the {deviceid} pattern, it will be automatically replaced by the identifier of the device displaying the web announcement.
trans-unit.target: From a Reach web announcement, if the HTML code of the announcement contains the {deviceid} pattern, it will be automatically replaced by the identifier of the device displaying the web announcement.

trans-unit.source: Here is my device identifier: {deviceid}
trans-unit.target: Here is my device identifier: {deviceid}

trans-unit.source: will be replaced by:
trans-unit.target: will be replaced by:

trans-unit.source: Here is my device identifier: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
trans-unit.target: Here is my device identifier: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

trans-unit.source: Open your application on your device and perform an Event in your app which has been tagged.
trans-unit.target: Open your application on your device and perform an Event in your app which has been tagged.

trans-unit.source: From "UI - your app - Monitor - Events - Details", find the Event you performed in the list.
trans-unit.target: From "UI - your app - Monitor - Events - Details", find the Event you performed in the list.

trans-unit.source: Click to this event in the Monitor.
trans-unit.target: Click to this event in the Monitor.

trans-unit.source: You should find your Device ID in the list of the devices that have performed this event.
trans-unit.target: You should find your Device ID in the list of the devices that have performed this event.

trans-unit.source: Then, you can copy this Device ID and register it in the "UI - My Account - Devices - New Device - Select your device platform".
trans-unit.target: Then, you can copy this Device ID and register it in the "UI - My Account - Devices - New Device - Select your device platform".

trans-unit.source: (Be aware that when IDFA is disabled for iOS, the Device ID may change over the time if you uninstall and reinstall your app.)
trans-unit.target: (Be aware that when IDFA is disabled for iOS, the Device ID may change over the time if you uninstall and reinstall your app.)
